Deal.stylist¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

PortfolioHaircut.id¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

PortfolioHaircut.item_portfolio¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

PortfolioHaircut.menu_option¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

PortfolioHaircut.objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>¶
PortfolioHaircut.picture¶

The descriptor for the file attribute on the model instance. Returns a FieldFile when accessed so you can do stuff like:

>>> from myapp.models import MyModel
>>> instance = MyModel.objects.get(pk=1)
>>> instance.file.size

Assigns a file object on assignment so you can do:

>>> with open('/path/to/hello.world', 'r') as f:
...     instance.file = File(f)
PortfolioHaircut.price¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.
